alert.note: Alert for Greeley (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 14 at 7:27PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of central Nebraska, including the following county, Greeley. * WHEN...Until 715 PM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 724 PM CST, emergency management reported flooding in the advisory area. Minor flooding is already occurring. Only around one half inch of rain has fallen, but snowmelt and partially frozen soils is leading to minor flooding, mainly along county roads in rural portions of the county. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greeley, Spalding, Scotia and Wolbach. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
